page.title: 12Whiteparish Church
page.content: A recent survey indicates that{the {chancel, once the whole church, dates {from Saxon times (c.6AD).The orig.nave {was Norman (1189AD). Vestry-1969. Since 1984, the church has been floodlit at night. Unusually,{ALL {SAINTS'}priest serves only his own parish. About 75 people attend Sunday worship & possibly 150 during the major festivals. In common with a trend since the Second World War, the Communion is again the principal service. Evensong provides an alternate form. A robed choir leads the singing. Weekday services are few. The parish priest chimes the bell each morning & evening when he goes to say his Office, & pray for the people. Children at{ALL SAINTS' SCHOOL}have services here each term. (From information provided by the Vicar, the Reverend Roger Keeley.)
